metadata.title: Assessment Plan for Ansible Automation Platform 2.5+ based on ISA/IEC 62443-4-2 (SL-4 Target)

components.title: Ansible Automation Platform 2.5+
components.description: The target of this assessment is the production Ansible Automation Platform instance used for industrial control system automation.

parts.name: rules-of-engagement
parts.prose: This assessment will be conducted during normal business hours. No disruptive testing will be performed without prior written consent from the system owner.

control-selections.description: All controls implemented by the Ansible Automation Platform component as defined in the component definition.

assessment-assets.description: The assets used to perform this assessment.

tasks.title: Assess FR 1: Identification and Authentication Control
Assess FR 6: Timely Response to Events

activities.title: Verify Human User Identification and Authentication
activities.description: Verify that AAP is configured to uniquely identify and authenticate all human users with multifactor authentication via an external IdP.

steps.description: Examine the Identity Provider settings in the AAP web UI to confirm integration with a SAML or OIDC identity provider that enforces MFA.
Interview the AAP administration team to confirm that all user access is managed through the configured identity provider.
Test the login process by attempting to authenticate to the AAP web UI with a test user account, and verify that the user is redirected to the IdP and an MFA challenge is presented.

activities.title: Verify Authenticator Management
activities.description: Verify that secrets used by automation are stored in a hardware-backed external vault.

steps.description: Examine the Credential Types in the AAP web UI to confirm that a custom type for an external vault (e.g., HashiCorp Vault, CyberArk) has been created.
Examine the Credentials used by critical Job Templates and verify they are using the external vault credential type.
Interview the security team to confirm that the external vault is backed by a FIPS 140-2 validated HSM.

activities.title: Verify System Use Notification
activities.description: Verify a warning banner is displayed upon login.

steps.description: Examine the Custom Login Info setting in the AAP UI under Settings -> User Interface Settings to confirm it contains the approved system use notification text.

activities.title: Verify Authorization Enforcement and Dual Approval
activities.description: Verify that AAP enforces authorization via RBAC and supports dual approval via Workflow Approvals.

steps.description: Examine the Teams and Permissions settings in the AAP web UI to verify that administrative privileges are granted to teams, not individual users.
Examine a critical Workflow Job Template and verify that it contains an Approval node that requires approval from a separate team.
Test the dual approval workflow by launching the critical workflow as one user and logging in as a second, authorized user to approve it. Verify the workflow only proceeds after approval.

activities.title: Verify Mobile Code Control
activities.description: Verify that automation content is sourced from trusted, version-controlled repositories.

steps.description: Examine the Projects in the AAP web UI and verify that they are all configured to source playbooks from a trusted, internal Git repository over a secure connection (e.g., SSH or HTTPS).

activities.title: Verify Session Lock
activities.description: Verify that web UI sessions time out after a period of inactivity.

steps.description: Examine the 'Idle Time Force Logout' setting in the AAP UI under Settings -> User Interface Settings to confirm it is set to a short duration (e.g., 900 seconds).

activities.title: Verify Auditable Events
activities.description: Verify that the AAP activity stream captures all security-relevant events.

steps.description: Test the activity stream by performing a security-relevant action (e.g., launching a job, creating a user) and verifying that a detailed event is immediately visible in the Activity Stream view in the AAP web UI.

activities.title: Verify Audit Log Accessibility
activities.description: Verify that the activity stream is being forwarded to a central SIEM.

steps.description: Examine the 'Logging Settings' in the AAP UI to confirm that log aggregation is configured to forward all events to the correct SIEM address.

activities.title: Verify Continuous Monitoring
activities.description: Verify that the SIEM is actively monitoring AAP events.

steps.description: Interview the security operations team to review the SIEM dashboards and alerts that are configured for Ansible Automation Platform events.

activities.title: Verify Resource Management
activities.description: Verify that job slicing and instance groups are used to manage resource consumption.

steps.description: Examine the configuration of large Job Templates to verify that they are configured with 'Job Slicing' to break them into smaller, parallel tasks.
Examine the Instance Groups in the AAP UI to confirm that automation workloads are segregated onto dedicated execution nodes.

activities.title: Verify Control System Backup
activities.description: Verify that AAP's backup utilities are being used.

steps.description: Interview the AAP administration team to review the backup logs and confirm that the `awx-manage` backup utility is being run on a regular schedule.

activities.title: Verify Network and Security Configuration Settings
activities.description: Verify that the AAP configuration is managed as code.

steps.description: Examine the Git repository used to manage the AAP deployment and verify that the application configuration is defined as code using the `controller_` Ansible collections.
